snippet: The president submitted his last spending plan to a hostile Republican-led Congress. New initiatives include $19 billion for a cybersecurity plan.
abstract: Pres Obama transmits his last annual budget proposal to Republican-controlled Congress; budget would would surpass $4 trillion for 2017 fiscal year, with $19 billion allocated to  cybersecurity and 25 percent to discretionary spending for domestic and military programs to be negotiated; budget forecasts rise in deficit in current fiscal year to $616 billion from $438 billion, in part because of agreement between Obama and Congress to make some tax cuts permanent.
lead_paragraph: The president submitted his last spending plan to a hostile Republican-led Congress. New initiatives include $19 billion for a cybersecurity plan.

headline.main: Obama’s Last Budget, and Last Budget Battle With Congress
headline.print_headline: For Obama, One Last Budget, and One Last Budget Battle With Congress
